title: Various crates fail to compile with `-C target-cpu=native` (illegal instruction)

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
<details>
<summary>Error</summary>

```
process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name url --edition=2018 /home/runner/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec8[23](https://github.com/Milo123459/sushibot/runs/6183528358?check_suite_focus=true#step:6:23)/url-2.2.2/src/lib.rs --error-format=json --json=diagnostic-rendered-ansi,artifacts,future-incompat --crate-type lib --emit=dep-info,metadata -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=0 --cfg 'feature="serde"' -C metadata=fcbc4e02ad805fa6 -C extra-filename=-fcbc4e02ad805fa6 --out-dir /home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps -L dependency=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps --extern form_urlencoded=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps/libform_urlencoded-2fff4c29a2ff59cd.rmeta --extern idna=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps/libidna-6b832e0ab6195b3e.rmeta --extern matches=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps/libmatches-e6219e4354812bb6.rmeta --extern percent_encoding=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps/libpercent_encoding-902851a711fbe70a.rmeta --extern serde=/home/runner/work/sushibot/sushibot/target/debug/deps/libserde-9ea6f0c4986a4a5b.rmeta --cap-lints allow -C target-cpu=native` (signal: 4, SIGILL: illegal instruction)
```

</details>

I'm using the latest Rust (1.60.0) and this is running on Ubuntu 20.04 in a GitHub actions workflow. I've had this issue with other crates (sqlx) but those have seemed to just fix themself. This one seems to be persistent and wasn't occurring earlier (without any CI changes).
